# Day 16: Dragon Checksum

https://adventofcode.com/2016/day/16

## Part One

This is the first time I've included some sanity checks in my code. I love the [Smart::Comments](https://metacpan.org/pod/Smart::Comments) module.

```
❯ perl checksum.pl 20 10000
10000011110010000111
01100

❯ perl checksum.pl 272 `cat input` | fold
01000100010010111000010110111011101001000100010010111100010110111011101001000100
01001011100001011011101110110100010001001011110001011011101110100100010001001011
10000101101110111010010001000100101111000101101110111011010001000100101110000101
10111011101101000100010010111100
10010010110011010
```

## Part Two

What if we just made it *bigger*? My recursive function resulted in needing to hard reboot my laptop. Oops. Time to optimize.

```
❯ perl checksum.pl 35651584 `cat input` | fold | tail
01001011100001011011101110110100010001001011110001011011101110110100010001001011
10000101101110111010010001000100101111000101101110111010010001000100101110000101
10111011101101000100010010111100010110111011101001000100010010111000010110111011
10100100010001001011110001011011101110110100010001001011100001011011101110110100
01000100101111000101101110111010010001000100101110000101101110111010010001000100
10111100010110111011101001000100010010111000010110111011101101000100010010111100
01011011101110110100010001001011100001011011101110100100010001001011110001011011
10111011010001000100101110000101101110111011010001000100101111000101101110111011
0100010001001011100001011011101110100100010001001011110001011011
01010100101011100
perl checksum.pl 35651584 `cat input`  7.69s user 1.57s system 85% cpu 10.791 total 4660k max rss
```

There are some folks on Reddit discussing pure mathematical approaches to this problem, but frankly I'm not bright enough to figure that out.
